required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pancreatic Cancer Recurrence in the Netherlands
clinical_study.official_title: Detection, Treatment and Survival of Pancreatic Cancer Recurrence in the Netherlands

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this nationwide, observational cohort study is to evaluate current surveillance strategies after primary resection of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) in the Netherlands, with regard to the detection, treatment and survival of PDAC recurrence.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of PDAC recurrence within the Netherlands; PDAC recurrence is either pathologically proven, or suspected through cross-sectional imaging, preferably confirmed by consensus during a multidisciplinary meeting.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Asymptomatic vs. symptomatic: Symptomatic recurrence is defined as the presence of symptoms suggestive for PDAC recurrence at recurrence diagnosis. If PDAC recurrence is detected in absence of suspected symptoms, disease recurrence was defined as asymptomatic. First site of recurrence: isolated local recurrence, liver-only, lung-only, multiple-site, other isolated distant Early vs. late recurrence: disease-free survival â‰¥12 months vs. <12 months

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Either systemic and/or local treatment or best-supportive-care

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival (from the time of resection), disease-free survival (from the time of resection), post-recurrence survival (from the time of recurrence diagnosis)

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of symptoms at time of (suspected) recurrence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Which symptoms are associated with PDAC recurrence?

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance score at time of recurrence detection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: What is the ECOG performance score of patients at time of recurrence diagnosis?

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of imaging procedures during follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: How much imaging procedures are performed during postoperative follow-up for the detection of PDAC recurrence? Are these procedures routinely performed?

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a follow-up period up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: How often is PDAC recurrence histologically confirmed?

study_pop.textblock: All patients registered within the prospective, mandatory Dutch Pancreatic Cancer Audit who underwent resection of histologically proven PDAC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing a pancreatic resection (PPPD, Whipple, distal pancreatectomy or total pancreatectomy) for histologically proven PDAC in one of the 16 Dutch centers for pancreatic surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with 30-day postoperative mortality

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
